Blog.post: Course Objective This course is designed to help students understand that high school is different from middle school and that there are certain expectations and personal responsibilities that are required to be a successful student and to graduate. The main concepts to be covered in this course focus on goal setting, personal actions, study and critical thinking skills, organization, and basic computer applications. This course is to serve a three-fold function: 1) to help students develop a sense of their own ability to succeed; 2) to give them a set of tools to empower then to be successful in accomplishing their personal and academic goals; 3) to give them practice in using these tools.

Syllabus for Mastering the Game of School: Student Success Skills My Goal: To coach freshman students in the transition between middle school and high school. Course Description: This is a one-semester class intended to give students the skills necessary to achieve academic and personal success at the high school level. Required Text: Learning to Learn Course Components: Goal Setting Time Management Organizational Skills Study and Critical Thinking Skills Test Preparation Content Area Reading Research and Library Skills Technology (Computer Literacy) Social Skills (Personal Actions) Response-Ability Training Vocabulary Development Learning Styles Multiple Intelligences Portfolios Grading Policy: You EARN your grade in this class through skill mastery and demonstration. Progress Reports will be sent home every 6 weeks. The final grade at the end of the semester remains on the permanent transcript. Grades are determined by totaling the points possible and the points earned. The following grading scale is used to determine your grade: 100-90%=A 80-90%=B 70-79%=C 60-69%=D 59-0%=F P
